PVoid

Copy

public static void Copy( PUInt32 dst, int p0, uint[] src, int p1, int len );
Copies a C# uint32 array into a PUInt32 class.
Parameters:
dst - The destination allocated memory.
p0 - The index to start copying to.
src - The source uint32 array.
p1 - The index to start copying from.
len - The number of atomic (uint32) elements to copy.

Copy

public static void Copy( uint[] dst, int p0, PUInt32 src, int p1, int len );
Copies a PUInt32 into a C# array.
Parameters:
dst - The destination C# array.
p0 - The index to start copying to.
src - The allocated memory array to copy from.
p1 - The index to start copying from.
len - The number of atomic (uint32) elements to copy.

SizeOfType

public override int SizeOfType();
Returns sizeof(uint), 4 bytes as per MS specification, this is the 'atomic' element size.
See Also:
PVoid

uint*

public static implicit operator uint*( PUInt32 p );
Casts a PUInt32 to an unsafe pointer to uint32 (uint32*)
Parameters:
p - The PUInt32 to cast to uint32
